thread.title: Coronation Street beauty Helen Flanagan shows off toned legs in short skirt and stilettos as she brings glamour on set
thread.title_full: Coronation Street beauty Helen Flanagan shows off toned legs in short skirt and stilettos as she brings glamour on set

title: Coronation Street beauty Helen Flanagan shows off toned legs in short skirt and stilettos as she brings glamour on set
text:
TV Magazine FLIRTY FLANAGAN Coronation Street beauty Helen Flanagan shows off toned legs in short skirt and stilettos as she brings glamour on set 
The actress arrived on-set in Salford in her flirty outfit ready to film scenes as Rosie Webster Pictured By BETH ALLCOCK, Showbiz Reporter 22nd February 2017, 1:06 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GLAMOURPUSS Helen Flanagan added a splash of sass to the Coronation Street cobbles as she strutted around in pom pom heels and a fur coat while filming her latest scenes. 
Her role as model Rosie Webster demands a whole lots of flirtiness and she flashed her toned legs as she went tights-free in her grey skirt with a raised hemline at the side. Eamonn and James Clarke 2 Helen Flanagan flashed her legs in a mini skirt as she arrived at the Coronation Street studios 
Yummy mummy Helen wrapped up against the winter chill with a fluffy white fur coat and matched the snuggly theme with her striking silver stilettos – which had a pink pop pop on the end of each. 
Her hair was styled into loose brunette waves and she looked ready for a day playing Kevin Webster’s eldest daughter as she arrived on-set clutching a huge Starbucks take-away cup. 
The mum-of-one raised a half-smile for photographers as she entered the Corrie hub at Salford Quays, in Manchester. Eamonn and James Clarke 2 The actress flashed a half-smile at the photographers waiting at the set 
She made her return to the soap earlier this year after five years away and was immediately embroiled in a drugs storyline with on-screen sister Sophie (Brooke Vincent) and mate and rumoured love interest Adam Webster (Sam Robertson). 
Her character returned from America and drama immediately ensued. 
Rosie’s explosive return from America to Wetherfield with Sophie saw her immediately embroiled in a drugs scandal with Adam. 
The sisters bring the drugs back from the States, discovering them in a bag of sweets, and swiftly attempt to dispose of them. related stories Channel 4's The Royal House of Windsor explores past 100 years of the famous dynasty it's Actually happening Find out who’s returning for the mini-sequel to Love Actually – and when you can see it GROWING FAMILY Here's what we know about the latest additions to Madonna's brood - twins Stella and Esther WHO'S THAT GIRL? Lewis Bloor has cheated on Marnie Simpson with Bristol girl Amelia Guest - here's the lowdown DADDY'S HOME Jeremy McConnell sets up home in Liverpool with Stephanie Davis and newborn Caben-Albi and has 'no intention of returning to Dublin' 'WHAT A BEAUTIFUL MAN' This Morning viewers swoon over Ricky Whittle but question his bizarre new accent THE OTHER WOMAN Katie Price is set to confront ex-BFF Jane Pountney who had an affair with hubby Kieran - the lowdown on Jane A WHOLE LOTT OF LEG Pixie Lott flashes her legs in short white dress with boyfriend Oliver Cheshire at star-studded bash LET ME ENTERTAIN YOU Robbie Williams fighting to be fit for Brit Awards show after 'suffering serious back pain' Abs-olutely solid Frankie Essex posts incredible photo of her new abs after getting rid of her 'saggy belly' Battling on All you need to know about Game of Thrones star Rose Leslie and her edgy new role STRICTLY AN ANGEL Who is Sunetra Sarker? Strictly star and Brookside, No Angels and Casualty actress on Who Do You Think You Are? 
Despite again dressing up to the Nines to resume her role, Helen, 26, has revealed she wanted her character to be less “catty” to make her comeback. 
“She’s turned a corner,” Helen explained. “Rosie has come back a lot more likeable now which won’t be boring to watch. I just think it’s easier to play. It feels more real to play it like that. 
“I didn’t really enjoy playing Rosie when I was younger in a nasty and catty way. I didn’t like it because it didn’t feel real to the situations if you know what I mean.” 
But there are some benefits to being on the show – being glam for the 9-5 before she goes back to being too busy for makeup while on mum duty. 
“The best thing about playing Rosie is that she’s so glam. I love getting my make-up done and my hair extensions blow-dried every day, which you don’t get to do when you’re a mum.” 
She added: “When I was in the show before, everyone was always jealous of my wardrobe and I definitely had the longest time in hair and make-up. 
“Rosie and Sophie do become window cleaners to help out their dad Kevin. The outfits are not very glam. But I am hoping it is short lived!”
